sub_title: Global Total Rewards Analytics Leader @ Cargill | Certified Analytics Professional | Help leaders make better decisions
summary:
I am a seasoned professional with 10+ years of proven track record of "GETTING THINGS DONE" in designing, advising and implementing strategic, feasible and robust solutions for business leaders (with a great focus on Human Resources, Consulting and Analytics). My competencies and skills are applicable to various HR functions across employee life cycle, with demonstrated strength in aligning people, organization and strategy (based on data analytics) to improve efficiency and effectiveness. I strongly believe in life-long learning and have continued my education by completing an MBA in Hanze University of Applied Sciences, attaining my SHRM Senior Certified Professional credential (SHRM-SCP), and continually attending various business-related courses, especially online and in data analytics (mostly with Academy to Innovate HR - www.aihr.com). Thankfully, my studies and works have brought me valuable international friends, and life experiences in Vietnam, Singapore, Thailand, The Netherlands, and France. Currently I am passionately leading the Total Rewards Analytics agenda for Cargill, US’s biggest private company.

Above all, I am constantly excited about putting together my accumulated knowledge, skills and experience in HR & People Analytics to positively contribute to people and business performance of my current and future organizations.

When I am not on the job, I love cooking with my lovely wife, running long distances, exploring new places and making new friends.

If you would like to learn more about how my services can help you or your company, please reach out via email (nhtrung.daniel@gmail.com)

awards:
[{'title': 'Hanze IBS Master Valedictorian - Class of February 2018', 'description': 'Having achieved the highest GPA score (8/10) of a 45-student cohort (2016-2018), I took the role of the Valedictorian to deliver the master graduation speech.', 'issuer': 'Hanze Hogeschool/ Hanze University of Applied Sciences, Groningen', 'date': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, {'title': 'Orange Tulip Scholarship 2016', 'description': 'Won Orange Tulip Scholarship to study at Hanze University of Applied Sciences starting in the academic year of 2016-2017. The OTS scholarships in Vietnam are managed and promoted by Nuffic - Neso Vietnam. 

Nuffic - Neso is a non-profit organization funded by the Dutch Ministry of Education. Nuffic - Neso is representative office of Nuffic, the Netherlands organization for international cooperation in higher education. Nuffic - Neso Vietnam is the official education office of Dutch Higher education in Vietnam. The office provides information on more than 2,100 study programmes taught in English by Dutch Universities and counsels students free of charge. Nuffic - Neso Vietnam also initiates and
facilitates institutional cooperation between Vietnamese and Dutch universities

The Orange Tulip Scholarship Programme (OTS) gives talented students in several Neso countries the opportunity to study in the Netherlands. It is offered by higher education institutions, multinationals and government institutions.', 'issuer': 'Nuffic Neso Vietnam', 'date': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, {'title': 'SHRM - SCP (Senior Certified Professional)', 'description': "Passed exam and obtained the credential of Senior Certified Professional awarded by Society for Human Resource Management (aka SHRM - SCP)

The Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM) is a professional human resources membership association headquartered in Alexandria, Virginia. The largest association in its field, SHRM promotes the role of HR as a profession and provides education, certification, and networking to its members, while lobbying Congress on issues pertinent to labor management.

HR professionals who develop strategies, lead the HR function, foster influence in the community, analyze performance metrics, and align HR strategies to organizational goals, should take the SHRM-SCP exam. 

Earning your SHRM-CP or SHRM-SCP credential makes you a recognized expert and leader in the HR field—and a valuable asset to your organization, keeping you and your organization more competitive in today's economy. This professional distinction sets you apart from your colleagues, proving your high level of knowledge and skills.", 'issuer': 'Society for Human Resource Management', 'date': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, {'title': 'Fifth prize Team Category in Singapore National Vertical Marathon 2010', 'description': 'Trained and led a team of 5 (from SMU Running Club) to win Fifth prize Team Category in Singapore National Vertical Marathon 2010', 'issuer': 'Nanyang Technology University (NTU) Sports Club', 'date': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, {'title': 'Champion Team of Procter & Gamble (P&G) - SMU Social Media Challenge 2010', 'description': 'Led a team of 4 to win Procter & Gamble (P&G) - SMU Social Media Challenge 2010 (a 2-month campaign promoting P&G’s CSR Activities in South East Asia through social media)', 'issuer': 'Procter & Gamble (P&G)', 'date': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, {'title': 'Champion Team of NUS I4Vietnam Competition', 'description': 'Surpassed 20 other teams to prevail as Champion in NUS I4Vietnam English public speaking competition with proposal Micro Transform in Vietnam’s tertiary educational system', 'issuer': 'VNCNUS - Vietnamese Student Community at National University of Singapore (NUS)', 'date': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, {'title': 'Singapore Scholarship, 2006-2010', 'description': 'Won Singapore Scholarship which was offered by Singapore Government to students from the other ASEAN member countries with outstanding academic record and leadership potentials. It was tenable for a full-time undergraduate degree course at one of the three universities in Singapore: NUS, NTU & SMU.', 'issuer': 'Singapore Ministry of Foreign Affairs', 'date': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}}]

In this role (director level equivalent), I own the global Total Rewards analytics strategic agenda, promoting the needs of various partner groups while prioritizing and developing analytics solutions required. Specifically, I lead (and enable the global & local teams in their effort for) the design, implementation and translation of data and analytics into total rewards insights that uncover new ideas, opportunities and strategies on the way we engage with and empower our colleagues, employees, leaders, partners and customers.

- A series of Power BI reports & dashboards that not only meaningfully answer key business questions and call for impactful decisions and actions, but also aim at constantly building data & analytics capability for the team, and improving data integrity for Total Rewards COE and beyond, in areas such as Headcount, Pay Competitiveness, Compensation History, Recognition, Global Mobility, Employee Engagement, and Living Wage.
- Enable all Total Rewards strategic initiatives from an analytics standpoints by advising on and/or implementing success measures, surveys & focus group interviews, advanced reports or dashboards

volunteer_experiences:
[{'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'role': 'Patient Service Associate', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Gentle Fund Organization', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQGSucAcI1NBsQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1519885160805?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=OYGgt1BzgEu1ES6hDtc0FB9AxzZSmj0EtC1dAVjFbho', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/gentle-fund-organization/'}, 'cause': 'HEALTH', 'description': 'With a team of 5-10 associates, I provided physical and emotional support for Vietnamese patients (esp. children) and their families during their short stays in Singapore as they came for consultation and examinations in various hospitals in Singapore. I volunteered not because they were under-privileged people (in fact many of them could afford the expensive treatments in Singapore). Rather, it was because I could sense their joy and relief in having someone help them communicate with the doctors and nurses, and help them get around in a place far from home. On top of that, I learned how precious yet fragile health could be, and that it was important to take care of oneself and the loved ones.'}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'role': 'Co-founder, member of Core Team', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Sunday Running Club - SRC', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'SOCIAL_SERVICES', 'description': '- Serving in the executive committee (aka Core Team) of Sunday Running Club since January 2013.
- With a team of 9 members, establish and implement club strategy and plans 
- Successfully co-organized various internal and external activities, serving up to 1,000 runners, their friends and family members

SRC was established in early 2013 with the Vision to become the biggest running club in Vietnam, bringing the running experience to people of all ages not only as a sport, a healthy lifestyle but also as a never-ending passion that is felt each time one puts on the shoes and hits the roads. Our club is suitable for beginners, aspiring runners training for various distances such as 5km, 10km, Half marathon, Full marathon and even Ultra marathon.
Our Core Values are: Sharing- Responsible- Connecting. SRC’s Mission is to create and nurture a running community, a great platform for all passionate runners who want to enrich their knowledge and experience in this sport.
SRC Website: www.sundayrunningclub.com
SRC Facebook Group: www.facebook.com/groups/sundayrunningclub
SRC Facebook Page: www.facebook.com/sundayrunningclub
